sanskrit_verse:
योगाधमनविक्रीतं योगदानप्रतिग्रहम् ।
यत्र वाऽप्युपधिं पश्येत्तत्सर्वं विनिवर्तयेत् ॥ ८.१६५॥
transliteration:
yogādhamanavikrītaṁ yogadānapratigraham |
yatra vā'pyupadhiṁ paśyet tatsarvaṁ vinivartayet || 8.165 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Wherever there is distortion of yogic conduct, or improper acceptance of yogic gifts, all such transactions rooted in conditioning must be reversed.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the unconditioned Self alone
Causation arises from misalignment with yogic integrity
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by proximity to dharma-adhikara
Restoration logic operates through withdrawal of false attribution
Consciousness alignment requires dissolution of transactional ego-bindings
executable_legal_axioms: IF a transaction involves distortion of yogic discipline THEN reverse all associated exchanges
IF a gift is accepted without dharmic clarity THEN nullify the act and restore original state
IF upadhi (conditioning) is detected in any exchange THEN initiate completion process automatically
IF consciousness misalignment is observed THEN trigger capacity-realignment protocol
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving spiritual or yogic institutions, the court must assess whether transactions were conducted under pure intent. If contamination by personal desire or social manipulation is found, the entire transaction must be unwound not for punitive reasons but to realign the institution with its foundational dharma.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that distorted yogic conduct originates from upadhi. The sequential manifestation begins with ego-involvement and culminates in false ownership. Therefore, proportional responsibility lies in undoing the transaction rather than imposing suffering. This aligns with Nyaya as it restores pramā (correct knowledge) and removes viparyaya (false cognition).
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate transaction reversal protocols upon detection of adharmic motive
Engage participant awareness restoration through śuddhi kriyā
Realign institutional energy fields via sattvic purification
Activate dharmic memory recall to dissolve binding impressions
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: All distortions in yogic exchange are hereby nullified. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as sole adjudicator.
